title: Venezuela: Citibank and FUDEP Launch "Tu Hogar Con Citi"
summary: Caracas, Venezuela - On Wednesday, May 15, as part of the "Tu Hogar con Citi" (Your Home with Citi) program, the President of Citibank N.A. Venezuela, Nelson Acosta, and Mary Gloria Olivo, General Director of FUDEP (Popular Development Promotion Association), granted microloans to women and men seeking to remodel, expand or build their own homes.
tag-1: Venezuela: Citibank and FUDEP Launch "Tu Hogar Con Citi"
tag-3: Caracas, Venezuela – On Wednesday, May 15, as part of the "Tu Hogar con Citi" (Your Home with Citi) program, the President of Citibank N.A. Venezuela, Nelson Acosta, and Mary Gloria Olivo, General Director of FUDEP (Popular Development Promotion Association), granted microloans to women and men seeking to remodel, expand or build their own homes.
tag-4: "Tu Hogar con Citi" is a national program focusing on Zulia, Lara, Carabobo, the capital district and the northeastern region of the country. Citi developed the program in partnership with FUDEP to contribute to the well being of low-income families by offering them access to loans along with socio-juridical and technical-urban guidance for carrying out projects to improve their homes, quality of life and family living conditions.
tag-5: By providing legal support to help the beneficiaries complete the required documentation, the program also serves to strengthen their links to formal social institutions.
tag-6: "One of the program's goals is to offer technical support to ensure the successful completion of home construction projects and the best use of available resources," Nelson Acosta, President de Citi Venezuela, emphasized. "'Tu Hogar con Citi'" provides beneficiaries with financial education to help them understand how to access affordable financial resources and develop self-improvement projects."
tag-7: By providing social support and advice, the program strengthens family values, allowing family members to coexist more harmoniously by enabling them to improve their living conditions, added Mary Gloria Olivo.
tag-8: "'Tu Hogar con Citi' gave me the opportunity to improve the structure of my home, allowing my family to live in better conditions by repairing cracks to the infrastructure that could have caused an accident," remarked Beatriz Fernández, a beneficiary of the program in the state of Lara. "Now my daughters have a comfortable and appropriate living space where they can feel relaxed and safe."
tag-9: The loans are offered at an annual interest rate of between 4.66 percent and 6.66 percent, depending on family income, for terms of up to five years.
tag-10: "Citi is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families in the communities where we work, especially those who need it most, to allow them to improve their quality of life," Acosta added.
tag-11: Applications to the program are accepted via FUDEP: e-mail: tuhogarconciti@gmail.com Caracas: (0212) 8701424 / 8705972
tag-12: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-14: FUDEP FUDEP is a non-profit civil society association whose mission it is to promote social development in Venezuela. It has more than 20 years of experience working to improve quality of life for the majority of citizens and promote civil values. FUDEP seeks to generate and strengthen the capacity and opportunity for communities to manage their local development.
